poem:
**Trade Winds**

In the hush of morning news,  
tariffs flit like sparrows—  
quick escalations,  
a dance of percentages  
between two titans.  
Coal, gas—a game of checks,  
while Google's shadow  
looms over porcelain cups.  
Around the world the winds spin,  
a global breath  
held tight  
as ink spills on paper.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China unveils US tariffs and Google investigation in response to Trump levies Donald Trump has fired the opening salvo of his trade war, imposing tariffs on China on Tuesday that sparked instant retaliation from Beijing, amid fears for the global economic repercussions. Moments after US tariffs of 10% came into effect, China swiftly announced an anti-trust investigation into Google. China’s finance ministry also announced 15% tariffs on coal and liquefied natural gas, and 10% on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
